title: RIFLEx: A Free Lunch for Length Extrapolation in Video Diffusion Transformers
author: Min Zhao (Tsinghua University), Guande He (The University of Texas at Austin), Yixiao Chen (Tsinghua University), Hongzhou Zhu (Tsinghua University), Chongxuan Li (Renmin University of China), Jun Zhu (Tsinghua University), ...
relevance_why: The concepts of temporally consistent content generation are applicable to audio and speech generation tasks, particularly in generating coherent audio or sound timelines from text prompts.
background: Extending the length of video generation models while maintaining temporal coherence and quality without the need for retraining on longer sequences.
contribution: This paper introduces RIFLEx to solve the problem of temporal repetition and motion deceleration in video length extrapolation, achieving effective 2× and 3× extrapolation with minimal fine-tuning.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing methods for length extrapolation in video models frequently resulted in either temporal repetition or slow motion due to a fixed training length.
technical_comparison.novelty: RIFLEx addresses this by adjusting the intrinsic frequency of positional encodings, which alleviates the issues without major modifications to the architecture.

key_innovation: It uniquely minimizes intrinsic frequency to ensure that video extrapolation can occur within a single motion cycle, preserving both motion consistency and quality.
real_world_impact: This approach significantly enhances the quality and coherence of generated video content, which can be critical in fields like entertainment and education. No immediate real-world impact.
limitations: While RIFLEx performs well, it struggles with extrapolations beyond 3×, wherein quality degrades significantly.

new_terms.RIFLEx: **RIFLEx** stands for Reducing Intrinsic Frequency for Length Extrapolation, a technique to adjust frequency components in video generation for better temporal coherence.
new_terms.intrinsic frequency: **Intrinsic frequency** is a frequency component in positional encodings that dictates the repetition and motion characteristics of generated sequences.

open_sourcing: Project page and codes are available at https://riflex-video.github.io/
